intro: Cyrtandra axillaris, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy surface, while its stems are slender and hairy. Cyrtandra axillaris plays an important role in the ecological balance of Hawaiian ecosystems.
